cards.back: immediately. as the page loads into the browser.

cards.front: how do you insert Javascript into a web page?

cards.back: in the head or body sections.

cards.front: What if you don't want the script to execute immediately upon loading a page?
cards.back: then put it inside a function.

cards.front: where do you place functions and why?
cards.back: in the head section, this way they are all in one place, and they do not interfere with page content.

cards.front: when should scripts be placed in the body?
cards.back: when you want your script to be placed inside a function, or if your script should write page conten.

cards.front: when should you use an external javascript?
cards.back: when you want to run the same JavaScript on several pages, without having to write the same script on every page.

cards.front: how should an external javascript be referenced?
cards.back: when you want to run the same JavaScript on several pages, without having to write the same script on every page.

cards.front: how should an external javascript be referenced?
cards.back: ></script>. name the file with a .js extension.

cards.front: can the external script contain the <script></script> tags?
